summary.p:
This is volume 2 of a 2-volume copy of the Caturakarāti, by Beschi, entitled Dictionnaire Malabare Seconde partie on its title page. The first part is BnF Indien 228. The present volume contains:
the Poruḷakarāti.
the Tokaiyakarāti.
the Toṭaiyakarāti.
Description by Neela Bhaskar based on the digital images available on Gallica.

filiation.p: BnF Indien 228 is the volume 1 of this 2-volume manuscript.

supportDesc.foliation: Parallel Tamil and Arabic numerals on the recto, left margin, for U2. The folio numbering continues that of the first volume (BnF Indien 228), which ends with folio number 199 (that is, U1, f[1], is here silently counted as folio 200).

collation.desc: 1 folio = Caturakarāti: Title Page. No foliation. Implicitly considered as folio 200. 410 x 35 mm.
224 folios = Caturakarāti: Text. Tamil foliation 201-424 and parallel Arabic foliation. 415 x 35 mm.

handNote.desc: Same hand as in BnF Indien 228. Ducler's scribe.

additions.desc:
Description of contents on a detached sheet of paper:
Mr Ducler, N° 27 26 bis
Agaradi, ou Dictionnaire tamoul,
Seconde partie
rra na
ṟa ~ ṉ,
(ouvrage anonyme)
This claim to document the entries ranging from ṟa-ṉa (the first part having covered entries from a-va), is wrong as the text appears to begin with a entries, and progresses also into va. The entries are different from those in part one (Indien 228). This information is anyway misleading, as anyway, there are no Tamil words beginning with ṟa or ṉa.

binding.p: Original brown wood covers. 410 x 35 mm. Bound by rope.

origin.origDate: Internally dated. Copy begun 1828, November 18th. See beginning of copy statement (f[1]v). Dated to 1828 by Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1828 by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1833 (acquisition date by BnF). By Ducler's scribe, working around 1830.

provenance.p: Copied for Philippe Ducler by an unnamed copyist in Karaikal Jail. See Burnouf (1832).

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 70.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso. ― Puḷḷi-s added in the Tamil transcription. Vowel lenghth represented as found in the manuscript.
